title: Light Falls, Manchester Royal Exchange, review: Jarvis Cocker's terrific score adds to a life-affirming evening
text:
It’s a relief and a pleasure to be able to report that Sarah Frankcom bows out as artistic director of the Royal Exchange on a terrific, touching high.

Looking something like a spaceship that has crashed into a palatial 19th-century trading hall, the Exchange – in the round, its stage area exposed and compact - has a spirit and identity of its own and demands its custodians think outside the box. This Frankcom (who has taken up a post as principal at Lamda) has duly done.

She has awards to show for the risks taken, and strong attendance figures too. Yet strangely the shows I’ve thought most likely to wow us – such as her Hamlet and A Streetcar Named Desire starring Maxine Peake (a very regular...
description: It’s a relief and a pleasure to be able to report that Sarah Frankcom bows out as artistic director of the Royal Exchange on a terrific, touching high.
